body.p: To His Excellency Govenor Thos. E. Bramlette

The undersigned Citizens of the County of Gallatin would respectfully represent that One JohnJames A Gridley was indicted in the Gallatin Circuit for Various offenses upon which indictment bench warrants was issued admitting Said Gridley to bail in the Sum of $500, $500, & $2050 respectively and his brother O. D. Gridley became his Surity on his bail bonds for the Sum of , the said James A Gridley was fined at the March Term 1864 in the Sum of $2000 -- for the offinse of assault & batery -- which was an amount that he was wholy unable to pay and rather than be confined in the County Jail he has fled the Commonwealth, and has not appeared to answer the said three indictments in pursuance of his bail bonds, and at the last March Term of the Gallatin Ct, Ct, the Comth Attorney took Judgment against the Said O. D. Gridley his Surity upon the forfeiture of said three several bonds amounting to the sum of $12050 -- the said O D. Gridley Cannot pay said debt without great embarassment, We appeal to Your Excellency for the exercise of Your Clemency in his behalf we believe the Judgment Should be remitted so far as in Your power to do so, and hope You will favorably Consider the petition and we will ever pray &, &, &,

Jno. D. Pulliam
